intro: Pogonopus ottonis, commonly known as the Otto's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are often violet to purple in color and are pollinated by bees and other insects. Pogonopus ottonis is a perennial herb that is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
